title: American_Top_40_1986_November_15th
description:
"We're coming to you from Hollywood with the biggest hits in the USA. Up two notches, the band, Bon Jovi."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

A listener writes in to ask, "What albums in the 80's has spent the most weeks at number one?" Casey lists the top three.

Of all the recording artists who have been on the cover of Time Magazine, only one got to design his own cover, and he's in this countdown.

There is a song by the youngest artist in the 1980's to hit number one, and the artist whose record she broke was her big brother's.

Casey plays a portion of the only song in chart history ever to have been co-written by a Vice-President of The United States. The song made number one!

There is a song by the man whose records have been hitting the top 40 for the longest span of time in the rock era, beating Tina Turner who previously held the record of 26 years.

Casey explains how Alberto Vargas came to paint an album cover for The Cars.
